entry.title: City of Oakland to hear digital sign proposal from Superintendent
entry.summary: OAKLAND — The city of Oakland will be hosting a town hall at 7 p.m. Wednesday at Oakland City Hall, 637 NE Locust St., Oakland.

entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY THROUGH 10:00 A.M. THURSDAY
entry.summary: November 26, 2023 5:45 a.m. An Air Stagnation Advisory is in effect through 10:00 a.m. Thursday for much of the region. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said poor mixing and weak winds mean that stagnant air is expected, which may lead to deteriorating air quality in the valleys of southern Oregon. The Advisory area...

entry.title: Shop small Saturday draws out early Christmas shopping
entry.summary: Walking down Southeast Jackson Street in Roseburg on Saturday, every business had a sign out advertising the many deals associated with Shop Small Saturday.

entry.title: Christmas tree permits available
entry.summary: Get your Christmas spirit and axes ready, Christmas tree permits are available throughout Douglas County.

entry.title: Man damages patrol car while under arrest
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Ryan Arthur Ferguson was arrested Wednesday, and while under arrest kicked the Douglas County Sheriff's Office patrol car from the inside causing damage.

entry.title: Local campground wins awards from Kampgrounds of America
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Kampgrounds of America, the world’s largest system of publicly open campgrounds, announced the Sutherlin/Umpqua Valley Kampgrounds of America Holiday campground earned the Kampgrounds of America Founder’s and President’s awards. The awards were presented Nov. 16 at the Kampgrounds…

entry.title: Favorite reads of the year
entry.summary: As 2023 wraps up, I am reflecting on my favorite books of the year. Great plots, fully realized characters, amazing writing … I had another banner year of reading.

entry.title: Volunteers host free Thanksgiving meal in Myrtle Creek
entry.summary: MYRTLE CREEK — Ray Munoz was known for his kindness. Starting in 2017, he hosted an annual Thanksgiving dinner in Myrtle Creek, providing a hot, free meal made from scratch available for anybody in the community to partake in.

entry.title: Dark Disco in downtown Roseburg
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Draper’s Draft House, Ember & Ash and Reverie Record store are joining forces for the second annual Black Friday Dark Disco on the 600 block of Southeast Jackson Street in downtown Roseburg.

entry.title: Douglas County’s payroll employment drops in October
entry.summary: Douglas County payroll employment dropped a seasonally adjusted 240 jobs in October after increases of 70 in September and 200 in August.

entry.title: Sutherlin’s Sean Radford named 2024 Oregon Assistant Principal of the Year
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Focusing on students, their well-being and success, and how he can help them has led Sutherlin High School Assistant Principal Sean Radford to be nationally recognized.

entry.title: Small operating grants given to 119 arts organizations
entry.summary: Small grants that make a big difference for ensuring access to arts programming have been awarded to 119 arts organizations by the Oregon Arts Commission. Each organization will receive $2,363.

entry.title: Clay Place opens winter term registration
entry.summary: Umpqua Valley Arts has registration now open for the 2024 Winter Term Open Studio at The Clay Place.

entry.title: Christmas carol radio show at Umpqua Community College
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — Umpqua Community College Performing & Visual Arts will present "A Christmas Carol Radio Show," a comedy in two acts set in 1958, when a Los Angeles radio station puts on Charles Dicken’s “A Christmas Carol.”

entry.title: Turkey Trot happening Thanksgiving Morning at Wildlife Safari
entry.summary: WINSTON — Wildlife Safari will host its annual Turkey Trot at 8 a.m. Thanksgiving day.

entry.title: THANKSGIVING CLOSURES FOR THURSDAY
entry.summary: November 23, 2023 6:00 a.m. Thursday is Thanksgiving Day and that means there are a number of closures. Federal, state, county and city offices are closed. Regular mail will not be delivered. School is not in session. Banks and credit unions are not open. Professional offices are closed. Most retail outlets are either not open...
